The Hornbil 
 Bukheye Mulongo Christopher 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As I was moving in 
 
 Buŋanga vilage I found a 
 
 fat hornbil. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When I struck it with a 
 
 catapult, it shouted “ŋa, 
 
 ŋa, ŋa!” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The hornbil flew into the 
 
 air. 
 
 But I ran after it through the 
 
 gras… 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 …until it perched on a dead 
 
 tre. 
 
 Then I shot it again. 
 
 This time it fel to the 
 
 ground. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 I picked up the hornbil. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 And I gave it to Hiryagana: 
 
 one who eats whatever he 
 
 finds. (One time, I gave him 
 
 Namupongera.) 
 
 He hapily received the 
 
 hornbil. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The head of the hornbil 
 
 was very big and as hard 
 
 as a panga or machete. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The bird had fat like that of 
 
 a shep. 
 
 It was so apetising! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It’s not easy to find a 
 
 hornbil without planing. 
 
 At night, hornbils rost on 
 
 dry branches. 
 
 A person eats what he 
 
 likes. 
 
 That is why Hiryagana 
 
 eats hornbils. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9
